metadata.title: CVE-2019-19770 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** In the Linux kernel 4.19.83, there is a use-after-free(read) in the debugfs_remove function in fs/debugfs/inode.c (which is usedto remove a file or directory in debugfs that was previously created with acall to another debugfs function such as debugfs_create_file). NOTE: Linuxkernel developers dispute this issue as not being an issue with debugfs,instead this is an issue with misuse of debugfs within blktrace.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
